text: Travel back in time to one of the original kampung mosque, equipped with banana trees and belimbing buloh tree. Do come n solat n contribute what you can to keep this mosque going. Insha-Allah
One of the few old style small mosques left in Singapore......very simple and felt the vibes of Malaysia......

Just visited the masjid for Solat Maghrib. Masya Allah it felt very close among congregants.

Years ago, I frequented this masjid so regularly when I was a trainee in one of the camps around. If there is still a mosque which preserves its original state and you’re looking to see the old kampung vibes, this is the place for you to perform your prayers. Note or caution: it is extremely inaccessible by public transport. Masya Allah.

The place of peace. The Masjid Al-Firdaus is one of the  old generation mosque in Singapore located in the West, at Jalan Ibadat, off Old Choa Chu Kang Road, There are religious classes for adults in the evening.

Alhumdulillah,
It good and very near for me to pray and we’ll capacity..
